intro: Suaeda leiosperma, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its salt-tolerant nature allows it to thrive in saline soils, making it an important component of desert ecosystems. Suaeda leiosperma plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat.
